result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James A OBERLE Jr was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after he served two years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Associated with Charge #1

ORDER REGARDING SENTENCE. 
Based upon the information provided to this Court, the Court finds that the Defendant,
James A. Oberle, Jr., has successfully served his sentence from July 24, 2015 through
October 18, 2017, for a total of 818 days, thereby completing both the revocation and
ignition interlock requirement of his sentence.

Order Regarding Sentence.
The Court finds that the defendant, James A. Oberle, Jr., has successfully completed the 36 month revocation of his operating privileges as well as the 36 month ignition interlock requirement of his sentence.

records.addlTxt: Copy of revocation summary from case no: 08 CF 35.

Defendant in custody.
GUILTY plea entered to count 1, OWI - 7th offense.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3 and 4.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of six (6) years.  That is three (3) years initial confinement followed by three (3) years extended supervision.
The defendant is found eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after he serves two years confinement. He is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Conditions of extended supervision:
1) pay $1,400.00 fine plus costs, total of $2,781.00;
2) maintain absolute sobriety;
3) AODA assessment and follow through;
4) provide DNA sample;
5) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.
Thirty-six (36) month DL revocation and period of Ignition Interlock is ordered.
Defendant has credit for 50 days.
Minutes.

Charging OWI-7th offense; operate with prohibited BAC; fleeing an officer and obstruct officer.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT -

Plea date is set for 09-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 07-02-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Cover Letter.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant requests counsel, will hire his own counsel because he does not qualify for the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 06-15-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Re:  Operate under influence (7th, 8th or 9th), on 06-04-15.

Defendant in custody on probation hold.
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of fleeing an officer, operate under influence (7th) and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-08-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.   Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
